meanings.definition: In a hawkish manner; aggressively or warily
meanings.sent1: She watched hawkishly as the unfamiliar dog approached her.
meanings.sent2: The soldier scanned the horizon hawkishly, looking for any signs of movement.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel eyed her hawkishly, wondering if she had any hidden treats.
meanings.sent4: The detective followed the suspect hawkishly, waiting for the perfect moment to make an arrest.
meanings.sent5: The teacher observed the students hawkishly during the exam to prevent cheating.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a hawk, especially in being predatory or vigilant.
meanings.sent1: The hawkishly dressed man stood out in the crowd with his sharp suit and tie.
meanings.sent2: Her hawkishly sharp eyes missed nothing as she scanned the room for any potential threats.
meanings.sent3: The hawkishly decorated room had pictures of birds of prey adorning the walls.
meanings.sent4: His hawkishly keen sense of smell could detect even the faintest hint of danger.
meanings.sent5: The hawkishly designed logo of the company conveyed a sense of strength and vigilance.
